title: Expressions: Add user notification for Strict Mode NaN behavior in Reduce component
body: **What is this feature?** This change introduces a contextual warning notification in the Reduce component when "Strict Mode" is enabled. The notification clarifies that `fill(null)` in InfluxQL produces `NaN` values instead of `null`, with a direct link to documentation explaining this behavior. **Implementation Details** - Added a `StrictModeWarning` component that conditionally renders based on the selected mode - Integrated with existing notification system using `useAppNotification` - Updated translation files with new i18n key: `strict-mode-fill-null-warning` **Why do we need this feature?** Addresses user confusion documented in #79315 where developers unfamiliar with InfluxQL's type coercion rules were surprised by unexpected `NaN` results. This proactive guidance reduces support requests and improves self-service capabilities. **Who is this feature for?** Primarily benefits: - Data engineers working with time-series data in InfluxDB - Dashboard maintainers implementing strict data validation rules - New users unfamiliar with InfluxQL's handling of null values **Which issue(s) does this PR fix?**: Fixes #79315 **Special notes for your reviewer:** - [x] Verified notification appears only in relevant contexts - [x] Added E2E test covering notification visibility - [x] Updated [InfluxQL documentation](docs/sources/influxql/querying.md) with explicit `fill(null)` behavior explanation - [x] Added to What's New document for v10.3 release
